We updated Todoist on your iPhone, iPad, and Apple Watch to bring everything up-to-date with the newest operating systems. Here are a few of the new goodies you’ll find in this latest version:

[NEW] A cleaner, simplified Today widget puts your Today task list a quick swipe or 3D Touch away. (You’ll need to be using iOS 10 to make this work.)

[NEW] A revamped Share Extension gets smart Quick Add making it faster than ever to save and organize webpages as Todoist tasks without ever switching apps (perfect for managing information overload and staying on top of your reading list).

[NEW] A redesigned Todoist for Apple Watch gives you the option to choose your own default task view to open whenever you launch the app – customize it to fit the way you use your Watch.
 
[NEW] We rebuilt Todoist for Apple Watch to make it much *much* faster. That means less holding up your arm for an awkwardly long time waiting for your tasks to load and more impressing your friends and coworkers with the fact that you can keep life organized from your wrist. (A very cool party trick. Trust us.)

Download the new update and start exploring the app today!

And as always, if you happen upon a bug or are enlightened with an awesome idea to make Todoist even better, let us know at support@todoist.com. We appreciate it :)

New things for iOS 11! 

== Add tasks and stay on top of your day with Siri ==
Your favorite personal assistant just got more useful. Ask Siri to add new tasks or pull up your task lists by project, due date, or both. Try out these voice commands: 

- “Add buy bread to shopping list in Todoist”
- “Add meeting with Alex tomorrow at 5pm in Todoist”
- “Show me all tasks for today in Todoist”
- “Show me all tasks for tomorrow between 5pm and 6pm in Todoist”
- “Show me the shopping list in Todoist”

== Drag and drop to Todoist on your iPad ==
From your iPad, you can now drag and drop anything – text messages, URLs, emails, images, PDFs, files – to Todoist.
- Dropping in a project, label, or filter view will create a new task.
- Dropping in the comment screen will start a new comment pre-populated with the relevant information
- Dropping in the Quick Add button will start a new task pre-populated with the relevant information.

== Attach any file to task and project comments ==
In addition to photos, you can now attach any kind of file – documents, PDFs, presentations, or anything else in your Files app or iCloud drive – to task and project comments from your phone.

== Forgot your password? Doesn’t matter == 
If you've saved your Todoist password to the iCloud keychain, it will autofill your keyboard when logging in to Todoist on any iOS device.

- You can now divide your project into Sections. Add a Section from the three dots menu in the top right of any project, then add tasks by dragging them into the section. Try using Sections to arrange your projects by stage (Research, Planning, Launch) or by timeline (Week 1, Week 2, Week 3).

- Manage every detail about a task – its due date, assignee, labels, sub-tasks, comments, and more – in one place with new Task View. Simply tap on the task to see it.

- Adding tasks just got easier with the more intuitive, redesigned Quick Add.  You’ll see small tags below the task name that display the due date, project, and task assignee. You can also now immediately set a reminder using the clock icon.

- Enjoy a more coordinated look across the app with colorful, redesigned icons on every platform.

- You can now see your completed tasks right within your project. Simply select “Show completed tasks” from the three dots menu and you’ll see checked-off tasks right in your project list. You can see them in task view, too.

- You’ll notice a more reliable, more responsive Todoist across the board thanks to a handful of user interface and under-the-hood updates and bug fixes. These also lay the foundation for powerful new features around the corner.
